checks.description: The app be installed on the target device
The app behave as designed/desired if there is an incoming call
The app behave as designed/desired when there is an incoming SMS
The app behave as designed/desired when the charger is connected
The app behave as designed/desired when the charger is disconnected
The app behave as designed/desired when the charger is disconnected
The app behave as designed/desired when the device goes to sleep mode
The app behave as designed/desired when the device resumes from sleep mode
The app behave as designed/desired when the device resumes from lock screen
The app behave as designed/desired when the device is tilted

The app interact with the GPS sensor correctly (switch on/off, retrieve GPS data)
The functionality of all the buttons or keys on the device defined for this app
Buttons or keys which have no defined function have no unexpected behaviour on the app when activating
In case there’s a true “back” button available on the device, the “back” button take the user to the previous screen
In case there’s a true “menu” button available on the device, the menu button show the app’s menu
In case there’s a true “home” button available on the device, the home button get the user back to the home screen of the device
In case there’s a true “search” button available on the device, this get the user to some form of search within the app
The app behaves as designed/desired if the “Battery low” message is pushed
The app behaves as designed/desired if the sound on the device is turned off
The app behaves as designed/desired if the device is in airplane mode
The app can be de-installed from the device
The application functions as expected after re-installation
The app be found in the app store (Check after it goes live)
The app switches to different apps on the device through multitasking as designed/desired?
All touch screen positions (buttons) are working when a screen protector is used
Does the app behaves according to specification if connected to the internet through Wi-Fi
The app behaves according to specification when connected to the internet through 3G
The app behaves according to specification when connected to the internet through 2G
The app behaves according to specification if the app is out of network reach
The app resumes working when it gets back into network reach from outside the reach of the network
Transactions are processed correctly after re-establishing a network connection
The app still works correctly when tethering or otherwise connected to another device
The app still works when the app switches between networks (Wi-Fi, 3G, 2G)
The app uses standard network ports (Mail: 25, 143, 465, 993 or 995 HTTP: 80 or 443 SFTP: 22) to connect to remote services, as some providers block certain ports
The app been tested on different type of devices and different versions of OS
Stability check: if the app has a list (for instance of pictures) in it, try scrolling through it at high speed. It is scroll smoothly?
Stability check: if the app has a list (for instance of pictures) in it, try scrolling to before the first picture or behind the last picture
The apps size does not prevent downloading when connected to cellular networks (according to wat is allowed by the OS)
Integration: The app connects correctly to the different social networks (LinkedIn, twitter, facebook, etc)
The app does not interfere with other apps when in background/multitasking mode (using GPS, playing music, etc.)
The search option in the app displays relevant results
Verified that most common gestures can be used to control the app (swiping, tapping, etc)
Unedisred actions/uses have been handled appropriately (e.g. undesired multitouch, for example – select two contacts from the phone book at the same time)
App name is self explanatory
The app name is self explanatory
Reloading of data from remote service has been properly designed to prevent performance issues at server-side. (manual reloading of data can reduce the amount of server calls)
The app go to sleep mode when running in the background
The user can go back to a previous screen by touching a back button
The main function of the app is apparent immediately. It should speak for itself.
One action on the screen that is highlighted as the most likely for the user. (Example: in iOS a blue button represents the default or most likely action)
User actions have been minimized by using a pickers, radio buttons and checkboxes (over textfiends when possible)
If there is a long list of data to scroll trough, a search option is provided above the list.
If performance is slow, a progress status icon (“Loading…”) is shown to the user
The appearance of buttons that perform standard actions are not altered in the app (for instance: refresh, organize, trash, Reply, back, etc.)
Standard buttons are not used for other functions then that they are normally used for
The app responds to all changes in device orientation, as per the design
You have not redefined gestures in your app that have standard meanings (example: swiping from top to bottom enables the notification center)
You have not redefined gestures in your app that have standard meanings (example: swiping from top to bottom shows notifications)
Requirement to login is delayed in the app as long as possible ... seriously, this is very annoying
Users are be warned about the consequences of deleting items in the app
